issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement labels the class as `Course` (line 63), but everywhere else—including task descriptions, test references, and the template/solution code—the class is named `Lecture`. This mismatch can confuse students about which class to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: In the UML diagram, change the class declaration from `class Course` to `class Lecture` so it matches the rest of the exercise.

issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement labels the class as “Course”, but both the template and solution repositories define and refer to the class as “Lecture”. This discrepancy can confuse students about the intended class name.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in the UML diagram from Course to Lecture so that it matches the class name used in the template and solution code.
